ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
>If Verant moves too far down this road EQ will whither and
>die just like DR is. Then we will move on to the next game
>until it gets too difficult to be fun anymore.
-----Original Message-----

You have also hit that nail right on the head. I am only a casual player,
and there have been many patches where I've felt a bit shafted. They have
made EQ into a beast that requires absurd amounts of time to make any
progress whatsoever. I used to have a great group of people to party with,
but I couldn't dedicate the 40+ hours per week that they did, so I'm enough
levels behind that I can't group with them and make any progress... so I'm
stuck at a mid level and I haven't been able to find another decent group
for the life of me. So instead of facing all the frustration, I'm wishing I
could just switch my characters to "inactive" status... where I can't play
the game, but they don't delete my characters.... so I can come back in a
year or so if nothing better comes along.

On the flip side, if EQ was just 50% easier, you wouldn't be able to pry me
away from that infernal compter. It's the excitement of making progress
that is so fun, and for the casual gamer, the progress curve in EQ is so low
after lvl 20 that it's just not that much fun anymore. I'd almost rather
spend my time playing Kingdoms or go back and play Bladur's Gate all the way
through, or best of all... go find a good text-based MUD where I can advance
at a reasonable speed then wiz and start adding my own imagination to the
world.

-Kzak

P.S. does anybody know a email address for feedback? I'd love to just share
some of these frustrations.
